analyzed: de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul @2a #// ba de la yongs su bsgom zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang / yid ches par bya ba dang / 'jug par bya ba dang / shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / yongs su khyab par bya ba dang / rab tu mchod par bya ba dang /
translated: Then, the merchant son Sudhana, the night goddess Sarva­sattva­trāṇojaḥśrī, the bodhisattva liberation called “the Taming of All Beings in All Worlds,”🔽he contemplated it, comprehended it, believed in it, entered into it, expanded it, pervaded it, made it very clear,

analyzed: dbang du bya ba dang / snang bar bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba byed cing /
translated: mastered it, illuminated it, and made it completely clear.

original: mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa gang na ba der phyin te mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab
analyzed: mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa gang na ba der phyin te mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab
translated: He went to the night goddess Sarojavanā, who was endowed with a vast ocean of peace, and bowed his head to the feet of the night goddess Sarojavanā, who was endowed with a vast ocean of peace.

original: tu zhi ba dang ldan pa la lan brgya stong @2b du mar g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tu zhi ba dang ldan pa la lan brgya stong @2b du mar g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He circumambulated the night goddess Sarojavanā, who was endowed with a vast ocean of peace, many hundreds of thousands of times, keeping her to his right, and then in front of the night goddess Sarojavanā, who was endowed with a vast ocean of peace, he placed his palms together in homage and made this request:

original: 'phags ma lha mo /
analyzed: 'phags ma lha mo /
translated: “Āryā, goddess,

original: bdag ni / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub du yang dag par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ni / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub du yang dag par zhugs pa ste /
translated: I have set out for the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: bdag ni / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la slob cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhugs te byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la nan tan du bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rab tu gnas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: bdag ni / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la slob cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhugs te byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la nan tan du bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rab tu gnas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'tshal na /
translated: I am training in the bodhisattva conduct by relying on the spiritual friend. I am engaged in the bodhisattva conduct. I am intent on the bodhisattva conduct. I am established in the bodhisattva conduct. I am seeking to emerge into omniscience.

original: 'phags ma lha mo /
analyzed: 'phags ma lha mo /
translated: “Noble goddess,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol /🔽de nas mtshan @3a #//
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol / de nas mtshan @3a #//
translated: please teach me how bodhisattvas should train in the bodhisattva conduct and how they should practice it.”

original: mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the night goddess Praśanta­ruta­sāgara­vatī said to Sudhana, the head merchant’s son,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: de ltar khyod dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol ba legs so //🔽legs so // rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de ltar khyod dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol ba legs so // legs so // rigs kyi bu /
translated: “You have well asked the spiritual friend about the bodhisattva conduct.

original: kho mo ni /
analyzed: kho mo ni /
translated: Excellent, excellent, son of good family!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba yangs pa'i shugs 'byung bas sems kyi skad cig rnam par brgyan pa thob pa'o //🔽nor bzang gis smras pa /🔽'phags ma / khyod ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba yangs pa'i shugs 'byung bas sems kyi skad cig rnam par brgyan pa thob pa'o // nor bzang gis smras pa / 'phags ma / khyod ni /
translated: I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called the display of the mind in every moment by the arising of the power of vast joy.

original: 'phrin las ci mdzad /🔽yul gang dang ldan /
analyzed: 'phrin las ci mdzad / yul gang dang ldan /
translated: Sudhana said, “Āryā, what is your activity?🔽What is your domain?

original: sbyor ba gang dang ldan /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang dang ldan /
translated: What is your practice?

original: ci la rnam par dpyod /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba yangs pa'i shugs 'byung bas sems kyi skad cig rnam par brgyan pa de'i yul ni /
analyzed: ci la rnam par dpyod / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba yangs pa'i shugs 'byung bas sems kyi skad cig rnam par brgyan pa de'i yul ni /
translated: What do you investigate?

original: ji lta bu zhig mchis /🔽des smras pa /🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig mchis / des smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: What is the domain of the bodhisattva liberation called the display of the mind in every moment by the arising of the power of vast joy?”

original: kho mo ni /
analyzed: kho mo ni /
translated: She said, “Son of good family,

original: @3b sems dang bsam pa rgya mtsho yongs su dag pa'i mnyam pa nyid du zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: @3b sems dang bsam pa rgya mtsho yongs su dag pa'i mnyam pa nyid du zhugs pa ste /
translated: I have entered the sameness of the ocean of pure mind and thought.

original: 'jig rten gyi rdul dang dri ma thams cad rnam par bsal ba'i mi phyed pas brgyan pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rdul dang dri ma thams cad rnam par bsal ba'i mi phyed pas brgyan pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of being adorned with the indivisible removal of all the dust and dirt of the world.

original: brtsams pa las mi ldog /
analyzed: brtsams pa las mi ldog /
translated: He had the intention of not turning back from what he had begun.

original: mi ldog pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi ldog pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of not turning back.

original: rin po che'i ri bo ltar yon tan gyis brgyan pa'i sems mi sgul ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo ltar yon tan gyis brgyan pa'i sems mi sgul ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of being adorned with the qualities of a precious mountain.

original: mi gnas mi rten pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas mi rten pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of not dwelling and not relying.

original: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la mngon par phyogs pa'i sems can dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la mngon par phyogs pa'i sems can dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of being a protector for all beings.

original: sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad mthong bas mi ngoms pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad mthong bas mi ngoms pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of never being satisfied with seeing the ocean of buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi stobs kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi stobs kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of the power of all bodhisattvas being pure.

original: dran pa'i rgya mtsho ye shes kyi snang ba chen pos brgyan pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i rgya mtsho ye shes kyi snang ba chen pos brgyan pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He had the intention of being established in the ocean of mindfulness adorned with the great light of wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad mya ngan gyi dgon pa las yang dag par bzla ba la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mya ngan gyi dgon pa las yang dag par bzla ba la zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are engaged in liberating all sentient beings from the wilderness of suffering.

original: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba las rnam par zlog pa la mngon par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba las rnam par zlog pa la mngon par brtson pa'o //
translated: They are dedicated to turning all sentient beings away from suffering and unhappiness.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yongs su rgyu ba rnam par zlog pa la zhugs pa'o //🔽sems can thams cad kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang bral @4a *//🔽zhing phrad pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar bya ba la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yongs su rgyu ba rnam par zlog pa la zhugs pa'o // sems can thams cad kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang bral @4a *// zhing phrad pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar bya ba la zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are engaged in turning away all sentient beings from the occurrence of unpleasant forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures.🔽They are engaged in pacifying the suffering of all sentient beings who are separated from what they love and who encounter what they do not love.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yul gyi rkyen las byung bas mgo rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam par zlog pa la rab tu brtson pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yul gyi rkyen las byung bas mgo rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam par zlog pa la rab tu brtson pa'o //
translated: They are dedicated to turning away from the suffering of confusion that arises from the conditions of objects.

original: log par ltung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: log par ltung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the support for all sentient beings who have fallen into error.

original: sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i gnas kyi sdug bsngal las 'byung ba yang dag par ston pa la mngon par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i gnas kyi sdug bsngal las 'byung ba yang dag par ston pa la mngon par brtson pa'o //
translated: They are dedicated to showing all sentient beings the way out of the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnam par zlog pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnam par zlog pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are engaged in averting the old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bde ba bla na med pa yongs su sgrub par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bde ba bla na med pa yongs su sgrub par zhugs pa ste /
translated: They are dedicated to accomplishing the unsurpassed bliss of the Thus-Gone One for all sentient beings.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas na 'khod pa'i sems can thams cad bde bar rim gror bya bas nyams dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas na 'khod pa'i sems can thams cad bde bar rim gror bya bas nyams dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are dedicated to bringing happiness to all sentient beings living in towns, cities, countries, regions, kingdoms, and capitals.

original: de dag la chos dang mthun par bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / rim gro bya ba yang legs par byed de /
analyzed: de dag la chos dang mthun par bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / rim gro bya ba yang legs par byed de /
translated: They protect, guard, and care for them in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de dag rim pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su smin par byed do //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag rim pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su smin par byed do // 'di lta ste /
translated: He gradually brings them to maturity in omniscience.

original: khang khyim dang / gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi mngon par chags pa med pa yongs su skyed do //
analyzed: khang khyim dang / gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi mngon par chags pa med pa yongs su skyed do //
translated: He causes beings who live in houses and palaces to give up attachment.

original: yid @4b mi bde ba de dang de dag kyang rnam par sel to //
analyzed: yid @4b mi bde ba de dang de dag kyang rnam par sel to //
translated: He removes their mental unhappiness.🔽He teaches the Dharma so that they will cut off all clinging and understand the nature of all phenomena.

original: mngon par zhen pa thams cad rgyun gcad pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to; ;pha ma dang / phu nu dang / sring mo dang / gnyen bshes dang / 'grogs pa'i sems can yun ring po nas bshes shing mdza' bar gyur pa dag las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phrad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa thams cad rgyun gcad pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to; ;pha ma dang / phu nu dang / sring mo dang / gnyen bshes dang / 'grogs pa'i sems can yun ring po nas bshes shing mdza' bar gyur pa dag las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phrad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma so that beings who have been friends and relatives for a long time—parents, siblings, relatives, and friends—will meet with the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: bu smad dang 'grogs pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sred pa thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems su bya ba dang / snying rje chen po rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: bu smad dang 'grogs pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sred pa thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems su bya ba dang / snying rje chen po rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are attached to their wives and children so that they will give up all craving for cyclic existence, so that they will have an attitude of impartiality toward all sentient beings, and so that they will attain great compassion.

original: tshong 'dus kyi dbus na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams la 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar bya ba la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: tshong 'dus kyi dbus na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams la 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar bya ba la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the middle of a marketplace so that they will be intent on seeing the noble Saṅgha and the Tathāgata.

original: longs spyod kyi dregs pas myos pa'i sems can rnams la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi dregs pas myos pa'i sems can rnams la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings who are intoxicated with the arrogance of wealth so that they will complete the perfection of patience.

original: glu dang / gar dang / rol mo la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la chos kyi dga' ba la mos par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: glu dang / gar dang / rol mo la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la chos kyi dga' ba la mos par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings who delight in song, dance, and music so that they will aspire to the joy of the Dharma.

original: yul gyi dga' ba la chags pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la yang dag par gzhol @5a *//
analyzed: yul gyi dga' ba la chags pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la yang dag par gzhol @5a *//
translated: To beings who are attached to the pleasures of objects, they teach the domain of the tathāgatas.🔽

original: bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those beings who are attached to the pleasures of objects, in order to introduce them to the domain of the Tathāgata.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those beings who are overcome by anger, in order to establish them in the perfection of patience.

original: khro bas yongs su non pa'i sems can rnams la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu dgod par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to; ;sems can le lo can rnams la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir chos
analyzed: khro bas yongs su non pa'i sems can rnams la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu dgod par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to; ;sems can le lo can rnams la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir chos
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those beings who are lazy, in order to purify for them the perfection of diligence.

original: ston to // sems rnam par myos pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: ston to // sems rnam par myos pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those beings whose minds are confused, in order that they may attain the perfection of concentration of the Tathāgata.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa thibs por zhugs pa'i sems can ma rig pa'i mun nag tu 'thom pa rnams la lta ba'i rnam pa thibs po dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par bsal ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa thibs por zhugs pa'i sems can ma rig pa'i mun nag tu 'thom pa rnams la lta ba'i rnam pa thibs po dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par bsal ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those beings who have entered the thickets of views and are wandering in the darkness of the gloom of ignorance, in order to dispel the thickets of views and the darkness of the gloom of ignorance.

original: shes rab 'chal ba can gyi sems can rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba can gyi sems can rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who are of poor intellect, he teaches the Dharma so that they may attain the perfection of wisdom.

original: khams gsum pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba las 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba las 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who are attached to the three realms, he teaches the Dharma so that they may leave cyclic existence behind.

original: dman pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who are of inferior aspiration, he teaches the Dharma so that they may fulfill their aspirations for the enlightenment of the Tathāgatas.

original: bdag la phan par brtson pa'i sems can rnams la sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: bdag la phan par brtson pa'i sems can rnams la sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who strive to benefit themselves, he teaches the Dharma so that they may fulfill their aspirations to benefit all sentient beings.

original: @5b bsam pa nyam chung ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: @5b bsam pa nyam chung ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who are of weak resolve, he teaches the Dharma so that they may purify the perfection of the bodhisattvas’ powers.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pas sems blong ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pas sems blong ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings whose minds are obscured by the darkness of ignorance, he teaches the Dharma so that they will attain the pure perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas.

original: gzugs mi sdug pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: gzugs mi sdug pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who have ugly bodies, he teaches the Dharma so that they will attain the pure form body of the Tathāgata.

original: lus kyi dbyibs mi mdzes pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la chos kyi sku bla na med pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: lus kyi dbyibs mi mdzes pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la chos kyi sku bla na med pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who have unattractive bodily shapes, he teaches the Dharma so that they will attain the pure, unsurpassed Dharma body.

original: kha dog mi sdug pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang / shin tu 'jam zhing ka tsa linda ka ltar reg na bde ba'i lus rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: kha dog mi sdug pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang / shin tu 'jam zhing ka tsa linda ka ltar reg na bde ba'i lus rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those sentient beings who have unattractive complexions, he teaches the Dharma so that they will attain the Tathāgata’s body, the color of gold, and a body that is very smooth and pleasant to the touch, like kācalindika cloth.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bde ba dam pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bde ba dam pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those who are suffering, he teaches the Dharma so that they may attain the highest bliss of the Tathagatas.

original: bde ba'i sems can rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bde ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: bde ba'i sems can rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bde ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those who are happy, he teaches the Dharma so that they may attain the bliss of omniscience.

original: nad pa na ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lus gzugs brnyan lta bu yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: nad pa na ba'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i lus gzugs brnyan lta bu yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those who are sick and ill, he teaches the Dharma so that they may attain the perfect body of a Bodhisattva, which is like a reflection.

original: dga' ba sna tshogs la brtson pa'i sems can @6a *//🔽rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dga' ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: dga' ba sna tshogs la brtson pa'i sems can @6a *// rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dga' ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those who are engaged in various kinds of pleasure,🔽he teaches the Dharma so that they may attain the joy of Bodhisattva conduct.

original: phongs pa'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gter dang mdzod rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: phongs pa'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gter dang mdzod rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For those who are in poverty, he teaches the Dharma so that they may attain the treasure and mine of the Dharma of the Bodhisattvas.

original: bza' shing gi ra ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pa'i rgyu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: bza' shing gi ra ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pa'i rgyu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For the sake of the beings who live in parks, he teaches the Dharma so that they will attain the cause for striving to seek the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: lam du zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: lam du zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For the sake of the beings who are on the road, he teaches the Dharma so that they will enter the path of omniscience.

original: grong na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la khams gsum pa thams cad las 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: grong na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la khams gsum pa thams cad las 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For the sake of the beings who live in towns, he teaches the Dharma so that they will leave the three realms.

original: yul gyi 'dabs na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la nyan thos dang rnag byang chub kyi lam las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la rab tu dgod par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: yul gyi 'dabs na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la nyan thos dang rnag byang chub kyi lam las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la rab tu dgod par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For the sake of the beings who live in the countryside, he teaches the Dharma so that they will transcend the paths of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and be established in the bhūmi of the tathāgatas.

original: grong rdal na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams la chos kyi rgyal po'i pho brang du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: grong rdal na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams la chos kyi rgyal po'i pho brang du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: For the sake of the beings who live in the villages, he teaches the Dharma so that they will dwell in the palace of the Dharma king.

original: phyogs mtshams na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings in the cardinal and intermediate directions so that they may attain the wisdom of the equality of the three times.

original: phyogs na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la chos thams cad kyi ye shes mngon par shes @6b par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la chos thams cad kyi ye shes mngon par shes @6b par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings in the directions so that they may attain the wisdom that is the knowledge of all phenomena.

original: 'dod chags la gcig tu dga' ba'i sems can rnams la mi sdug pa'i sgos 'khor ba'i sred pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: 'dod chags la gcig tu dga' ba'i sems can rnams la mi sdug pa'i sgos 'khor ba'i sred pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings who delight in desire so that they may turn away from craving saṃsāra through the practice of repulsiveness.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la byams pa chen po'i tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la byams pa chen po'i tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings who engage in anger so that they may enter the ocean of the way of great love.

original: gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la chos thams cad kyi sgo rgya mtsho rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes mngon par shes par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la chos thams cad kyi sgo rgya mtsho rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes mngon par shes par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings who engage in ignorance so that they may attain the wisdom that is the knowledge of the ocean of the gateways to all phenomena.

original: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa thams cad kyi smon lam gyi tshul rgya mtshos khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa thams cad kyi smon lam gyi tshul rgya mtshos khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who are engaged in the equal practice, so that they may progress by means of the ocean of aspirations of all the vehicles.

original: 'khor ba'i yul gyi dga' ba'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i yul dga' ba rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i yul gyi dga' ba'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i yul dga' ba rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who are attached to the pleasures of cyclic existence, so that they may turn away from the pleasures of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis gtses pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis gtses pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who are tormented by all the sufferings of cyclic existence, so that they may be free from the afflictions of all the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la mi skye ba'i gnas yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la mi skye ba'i gnas yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who are to be guided by the Tathāgata, so that they may be taught the state of non-arising.

original: phung po la gnas pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams la gzhi med pa'i chos kyi spyod yul la rnam par spyod par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: phung po la gnas pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams la gzhi med pa'i chos kyi spyod yul la rnam par spyod par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who have the intention of dwelling in the aggregates, so that they may engage in the domain of the Dharma that is without basis.

original: bsam pa zhum pa'i sems can rnams la lam gyi @7a *//🔽rgyan gyi khyad par yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: bsam pa zhum pa'i sems can rnams la lam gyi @7a *// rgyan gyi khyad par yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who are lazy so that they will be diligent.🔽I teach the Dharma to those who are proud so that they will have humility.

original: mtho ba'i nga rgyal can gyi sems can rnams la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi bzod pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: mtho ba'i nga rgyal can gyi sems can rnams la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi bzod pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who are arrogant so that they will have the patience of sameness with regard to all phenomena.

original: g-yo sgyu'i yul gyi bsam pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //🔽de ltar rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu'i yul gyi bsam pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to // de ltar rigs kyi bu /
translated: I teach the Dharma to those who are deceitful so that they will have the pure motivation of bodhisattvas.

original: kho mo ni /
analyzed: kho mo ni /
translated: “Noble one, in that way,🔽I bring all beings together through the gift of the Dharma,🔽I turn them away from all the suffering of the lower existences,🔽I teach them the excellence and happiness of gods and humans,

original: sems can thams cad chos kyi sbyin pas yongs su bsdus shing ngan song gi lam gyi rgyud sdug bsngal ba thams cad nas rnam par bzlog pa dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa dang / bde ba yongs su bstan pa dang / khams gsum pa las gyen du bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad chos kyi sbyin pas yongs su bsdus shing ngan song gi lam gyi rgyud sdug bsngal ba thams cad nas rnam par bzlog pa dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa dang / bde ba yongs su bstan pa dang / khams gsum pa las gyen du bskyed pa dang /
translated: I cause them to rise above the three realms,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu dgod pa dang / thabs sna tshogs kyis yongs su smin par byed byed pas dga' ba chen po'i shugs rgya mtsho snang ba rab tu thob pas dga' zhing spro la yid bde bar gyur pa'o //🔽gzhan yang rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu dgod pa dang / thabs sna tshogs kyis yongs su smin par byed byed pas dga' ba chen po'i shugs rgya mtsho snang ba rab tu thob pas dga' zhing spro la yid bde bar gyur pa'o // gzhan yang rigs kyi bu /
translated: They were delighted, joyful, and happy, having attained the ocean of the appearance of the power of great joy, through the various methods of ripening beings and establishing them in omniscience.

original: kho mo ni /
analyzed: kho mo ni /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,🔽I see the ocean of the assemblies of bodhisattvas in the cardinal and intermediate directions,

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho la rnam par lta zhing smon lam rgya mtsho la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lus sna tshogs rnam par dag pa 'od kyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho la rnam par lta zhing smon lam rgya mtsho la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lus sna tshogs rnam par dag pa 'od kyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang ldan pa /
translated: and I see the bodhisattvas who observe the ocean of the assemblies of bodhisattvas in the cardinal and intermediate directions and who practice the ocean of prayers, with various pure bodies,🔽adorned with various halos of light,

original: 'od zer dang 'od kyi @7b dkyil 'khor kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu 'gyed pa /
analyzed: 'od zer dang 'od kyi @7b dkyil 'khor kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu 'gyed pa /
translated: radiating infinite colors of light and halos of light,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa'i ye shes snang ba can /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa'i ye shes snang ba can /
translated: with the illumination of wisdom that has entered the ocean of various ways of omniscience,

original: ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa; rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyi yul dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa; rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyi yul dang ldan pa /
translated: they had entered into the ocean of various samādhis; they had the range of various miraculous manifestations;

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / skad rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyi dbyangs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / skad rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyi dbyangs dang ldan pa /
translated: they had the voices of the ocean of various melodies and sounds;

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyis rnam par klubs pa'i lus can /
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyis rnam par klubs pa'i lus can /
translated: they had bodies that were adorned with various ornaments;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
translated: they had entered into the various ways of the tathāgatas;

original: zhing rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa sna tshogs su zhugs pa'i lus dang ldan pa /
analyzed: zhing rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa sna tshogs su zhugs pa'i lus dang ldan pa /
translated: they had bodies that had entered into the various infinite oceans of realms;

original: sangs rgyas rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
translated: they had entered into the various oceans of buddhas;

original: tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa rgya mtsho sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
translated: they had entered into the various oceans of the discernments;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / ye shes kyi yul sna tshogs kyis snang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / ye shes kyi yul sna tshogs kyis snang bar gyur pa /
translated: they were illuminated by the various fields of the wisdom of the liberation of the tathāgatas;

original: ye shes rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa /
analyzed: ye shes rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa /
translated: they had attained the illumination of the various oceans of wisdom;

original: ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyi tshul la rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyi tshul la rnam par spyod pa /
translated: they were engaged in the ways of the various oceans of samādhis;

original: chos sna tshogs kyi rnam par thar pa'i gzhal med khang rnam par rtse ba'i yul dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos sna tshogs kyi rnam par thar pa'i gzhal med khang rnam par rtse ba'i yul dang ldan pa /
translated: the palace of the liberation of the various aspects of the Dharma, with a domain of play,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo sna tshogs le mngon du gnas pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo sna tshogs le mngon du gnas pa /
translated: the various gateways to omniscience appearing before them,

original: chos kyi dbyings sna tshogs kyi nam mkha'i rgyan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings sna tshogs kyi nam mkha'i rgyan dang ldan pa /
translated: the adornment of the sky of the realm of phenomena,

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa /
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa /
translated: the sky filled with the clouds of various adornments,

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho sna tshogs la rnam par lta ba /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho sna tshogs la rnam par lta ba /
translated: looking at the various oceans of the circle of the retinue,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs nas 'dus pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs nas 'dus pa /
translated: gathered from the various world systems,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs 'byams @8a *//🔽klas par rjes su 'dong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs 'byams @8a *// klas par rjes su 'dong ngo //
translated: following the various infinite buddha realms,

original: phyogs rgya mtsho sna tshogs nas yongs su 'dus pa /
analyzed: phyogs rgya mtsho sna tshogs nas yongs su 'dus pa /
translated: gathered from the various oceans of directions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pas bkye ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pas bkye ba /
translated: sent forth by the various tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pa'i zhabs kyi drung nas lhags pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pa'i zhabs kyi drung nas lhags pa /
translated: arrived from the presence of the feet of the various tathāgatas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs sna tshogs kyi 'khor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs sna tshogs kyi 'khor dang ldan pa /
translated: accompanied by various assemblies of bodhisattvas,

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pa /
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pa /
translated: a rain of various clouds of ornaments,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul sna tshogs la zhugs pa /
translated: the various ways of the tathagatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rgya mtsho sna tshogs la rnam pa spyod pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rgya mtsho sna tshogs la rnam pa spyod pa /
translated: the various oceans of the Dharma of the tathagatas,

original: ye shes sna tshogs rgya mtsho la zhugs pa /
analyzed: ye shes sna tshogs rgya mtsho la zhugs pa /
translated: the various oceans of wisdom,🔽and various seats with various precious ornaments.

original: rgyan gyi snying po sna tshogs can gyi stan la 'khod pa rnams kyi dga' ba sna tshogs kyi shugs rgya mtsho yongs su bskyed de /🔽de dag dga' ba sna tshogs kyi shugs rgya mtsho yongs su skyes nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtshor 'dong ste /
analyzed: rgyan gyi snying po sna tshogs can gyi stan la 'khod pa rnams kyi dga' ba sna tshogs kyi shugs rgya mtsho yongs su bskyed de / de dag dga' ba sna tshogs kyi shugs rgya mtsho yongs su skyes nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtshor 'dong ste /
translated: Having generated the various oceans of the force of joy,🔽they go to the various oceans of the assemblies of tathagatas.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs tshad med pa rjes su sems pas kyang dga' ba'i shugs chen po rgya mtsho yongs su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs tshad med pa rjes su sems pas kyang dga' ba'i shugs chen po rgya mtsho yongs su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through contemplating the immeasurable power of the tathagatas, they generate the various oceans of the force of joy.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble one,

original: gzhan yang kho mo ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho mo ni /
translated: furthermore,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs kyi sku yongs su dag pa mtshan gyis rab tu brgyan pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mthong nas dga' ba chen po dang / mos shing nyams bde ba rab tu 'thob ste /

translated: I saw the ocean of the gateways of the manifestations of the tathāgatas’ complete buddhahood at the site of enlightenment, which were revealed in every instant of mind.

analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du gyur par khong du chud par byed do //
translated: as being the same for all beings.

original: kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: In order to enter into the display of the conduct of Samantabhadra, I understand the realm of phenomena

original: rgyan gcig tu gyur par khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: rgyan gcig tu gyur par khong du chud par byed do //
translated: to be a single ornament.

original: dge ba thams cad kyis chos kyi dbyings rgyas par dgang zhing rnam par dag par bya ba chud mi za ba'i chos can du bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: dge ba thams cad kyis chos kyi dbyings rgyas par dgang zhing rnam par dag par bya ba chud mi za ba'i chos can du bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: In order to fill the realm of phenomena with all that is virtuous and to purify it, I understand the realm of phenomena

original: thug pa med par khong du chud par byed do //🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: thug pa med par khong du chud par byed do // rigs kyi bu /
translated: to be inexhaustible.

original: de ltar kho mo rnam pa bcu po de dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs thams cad yongs su bsags pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba nyid la 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings thams cad la rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar kho mo rnam pa bcu po de dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs thams cad yongs su bsags pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba nyid la 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings thams cad la rnam par blta'o //
translated: “Noble one, in that way, through those ten aspects I look upon the entire realm of phenomena in order to gather all roots of goodness and accumulations, to enter into the greatness of the nature of the buddhas, and to realize the inconceivable domain of the buddhas.”

original: khong du chud pa dang / rjes su gzhol bar byed do; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: khong du chud pa dang / rjes su gzhol bar byed do; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: I have attained them and I have mastered them.

original: gzhan yang kho mo de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid che ba nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i yid la bya ba dang ldan pas gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor @28b gyi rgyud stong phrag bcus sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho mo de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid che ba nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i yid la bya ba dang ldan pas gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor @28b gyi rgyud stong phrag bcus sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family, in this way, with a mind that follows the greatness of the Tathāgata, I teach the Dharma to sentient beings through ten thousand sections of the maṇḍala of dhāraṇī.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di ltar chos rgya mtsho thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos thams cad byin gyis rlob pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos kyi sprin thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rgya mtsho thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos thams cad byin gyis rlob pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos kyi sprin thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
translated: They are the maṇḍala of dhāraṇī called the perfect gathering of all oceans of Dharma, the maṇḍala of dhāraṇī that blesses all phenomena, the maṇḍala of dhāraṇī that holds all clouds of Dharma,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dgongs pa sgron ma'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtsho rab tu snang bar byed pa'i snying po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / theg pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dri ma med pa thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dgongs pa sgron ma'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtsho rab tu snang bar byed pa'i snying po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / theg pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dri ma med pa thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
translated: the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī lamp of the transcendent state of all tathāgatas, the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī essence that illuminates the ocean of karma of all sentient beings, the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī that perfectly engages all stainless oceans of ways of the yāna,

original: sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad kyi sgron ma'i snying po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo'i glong rab tu sgrog pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sngon gyi smon lam rgya mtsho bstan pa la yang dag par gzhol ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad kyi sgron ma'i snying po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo'i glong rab tu sgrog pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sngon gyi smon lam rgya mtsho bstan pa la yang dag par gzhol ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
translated: the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī essence of the lamp of all oceans of buddhas, the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī that proclaims the ocean of the names of all tathāgatas, and the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī that perfectly engages the teaching of the ocean of previous aspirations of the buddhas of the three times.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par 'khyil ba'i shugs drag po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par 'khyil ba'i shugs drag po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: the mandala of the dhāraṇī of the powerful coiling of all phenomena, and the mandala of the dhāraṇī called the arising of the power of omniscience.

original: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor bcu po de dag la sogs pa @29a *//
analyzed: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor bcu po de dag la sogs pa @29a *//
translated: Son of noble family, these are the ten dhāraṇī maṇḍalas,

original: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyud stong phrag bcus sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyud stong phrag bcus sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: and so on, with ten thousand dhāraṇī maṇḍalas, that I teach to sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang kho mo ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho mo ni /
translated: furthermore,

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to sentient beings through the wisdom of hearing.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: I teach the Dharma to sentient beings through the wisdom of reflection and the wisdom of meditation.

original: srid pa'i rgyud gcig las kyang brtsams shing sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyud gcig las kyang brtsams shing sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma to sentient beings by beginning with a single existence.

original: srid pa'i rgyud rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyud rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing sems can rnams la chos ston to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi mtshan gyi 'khor lo rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to; ;'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //

analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig gis lung bstan pa las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the prophecy of a single buddha.🔽I teach the Dharma beginning with the ocean of the prophecies of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis lung bstan pa rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis lung bstan pa rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the ocean of the retinue of a single tathāgata.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil @29b 'khor rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the ocean of the retinue of the maṇḍalas of all tathāgatas.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos kyi 'khor lo las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the ocean of the wheels of the Dharma of all tathāgatas.

analyzed: mdo sde gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single sūtra.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo la yang dag par gzhol ba'i mdo sde las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the sūtras that are dedicated to the wheels of the Dharma of all tathāgatas.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun nas 'dus pa las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the assembly of the retinue of a single tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun nas 'dus pa rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun nas 'dus pa rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with the ocean of the assemblies of the retinues of all tathāgatas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single thought of omniscience.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with an ocean of the branches of the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: theg pa gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
analyzed: theg pa gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with a single yāna.

original: theg pa thams cad kyi 'byung ba rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad kyi 'byung ba rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma beginning with an ocean of the origins of all yānas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble one,

original: de ltar kho mos bstan pa'i tshul mngon par sgrub pa brjod du med pas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de ltar kho mos bstan pa'i tshul mngon par sgrub pa brjod du med pas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: I teach the Dharma to beings through an inexpressible accomplishment of the way of teaching.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble one,

original: de ltar kho mo chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rgya mtsho la @30a *//
analyzed: de ltar kho mo chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rgya mtsho la @30a *//
translated: in that way I enter the ocean of the tathāgatas, who are the way of the undifferentiated realm of phenomena,

original: 'jug cing sems can thams cad la chos ston pas bla na med pa'i yongs su bsdu ba byed cing /
analyzed: 'jug cing sems can thams cad la chos ston pas bla na med pa'i yongs su bsdu ba byed cing /
translated: and I bring about the unsurpassed gathering of all beings by teaching the Dharma to all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa rgya mtshor gnas par bya bas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa 'di la sems kyi skad cig re re zhing rnam par 'phel ba'i rnam par thar pa'i yul sgom pa'i tshul gyis yongs su sgom ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa rgya mtshor gnas par bya bas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa 'di la sems kyi skad cig re re zhing rnam par 'phel ba'i rnam par thar pa'i yul sgom pa'i tshul gyis yongs su sgom ste /
translated: I will remain for an ocean of kalpas until the end of time, and I will cultivate the bodhisattva liberation called the profound manifestation of the pleasant sound, which increases in every instant of mind.

original: rnam par thar pa'i yul sgom pa'i tshul re res kyang sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs so //🔽nor bzang gis smras pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i yul sgom pa'i tshul re res kyang sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs so // nor bzang gis smras pa /
translated: With each method of cultivating the domain of liberation, I pervade the entire realm of phenomena in every instant of mind.”

original: lha mo / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa de de ltar zab pa ngo mtshar chen /
analyzed: lha mo / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa de de ltar zab pa ngo mtshar chen /
translated: Sudhana said, “Goddess, the bodhisattva liberation that you have is so profound and so amazing.

original: 'phags ma / khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'di brnyes nas ji srid cig lags /
analyzed: 'phags ma / khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'di brnyes nas ji srid cig lags /
translated: Āryā, how long has it been since you attained this bodhisattva liberation?”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: She replied, “Noble one,

original: sngon 'das pa'i dus bskal ba 'jig rten gyi rgyud kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol cig tu 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi 'od 'phro ba'i grong khyer dpal gyi sprin ces bya ba rin po che'i spos thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i dus bskal ba 'jig rten gyi rgyud kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol cig tu 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi 'od 'phro ba'i grong khyer dpal gyi sprin ces bya ba rin po che'i spos thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: “In the past, beyond as many kalpas as there are atoms in a buddha realm, there was a world system called Cloud of Glorious Cities of the Light of Dharma, which was made of all kinds of precious incense.

original: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sprin la blangs pa /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sprin la blangs pa /
translated: It was supported by clouds of as many world systems as there are atoms in a buddha realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi @30b smon lam dbyangs su sgrog pa'i padmos mtshams rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi @30b smon lam dbyangs su sgrog pa'i padmos mtshams rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: It was adorned with the sound of the past aspirations of all tathagatas.

original: lhun sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtshos byung ba'i nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po rgya mtsho las grub pa /
analyzed: lhun sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtshos byung ba'i nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po rgya mtsho las grub pa /
translated: It was formed from the ocean of the karma of all beings, and was made of the king of precious jewels.

original: padmo chen po'i dbyibs su 'dug pa /
analyzed: padmo chen po'i dbyibs su 'dug pa /
translated: It had the shape of a great lotus.

original: rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa /
translated: It was pure and defiled.

original: me tog gi khor yug ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis kun nas bskor ba /
analyzed: me tog gi khor yug ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis kun nas bskor ba /
translated: It was surrounded by as many flower-covered mountains as there are atoms in a world system.

original: spos kyi rin po che ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rgyan ri rab ltar mngon par 'phags pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: spos kyi rin po che ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rgyan ri rab ltar mngon par 'phags pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It was adorned with as many precious incense mountains as there are atoms in Mount Meru, and it was as lofty as Mount Meru.

original: gling bzhi pa chen po ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rgyan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa chen po ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rgyan dang ldan pa /
translated: It was adorned with as many great four-continent world realms as there are atoms in Mount Meru.

original: gling bzhi pa re re zhing yang grong rdal bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang ldan pa byung ngo //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa re re zhing yang grong rdal bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang ldan pa byung ngo //
translated: In each of the four continents there were unspeakable quintillions of cities.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble one,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i bskal pa mdog dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i bskal pa mdog dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba byung ste /
translated: in that world realm there was an eon called Stainless Light.

original: bskal pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ngo //
translated: In that eon there were as many tathāgatas as there are atoms in Mount Meru.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi 'od 'phro ba'i grong khyer dpal gyi sprin gyi gling bzhi pa dbu ma rgyal mtshan sna tshogs zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi 'od 'phro ba'i grong khyer dpal gyi sprin gyi gling bzhi pa dbu ma rgyal mtshan sna tshogs zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: In the world realm of the city of the cloud of the glory of the light of the Dharma there was a central four-continent world realm called Various Banners.

original: de'i dbus na rgyal po'i gnas rin chan me tog kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba yod par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dbus na rgyal po'i gnas rin chan me tog kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba yod par gyur te /
translated: In the center of that was the royal capital called Everywhere Shining Jewel Flower.

original: rgyal po'i gnas de dang ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na snying po byang chub chos kyi rgyal po'i pho brang rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: rgyal po'i gnas de dang ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na snying po byang chub chos kyi rgyal po'i pho brang rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: Not far from that royal capital was the site of enlightenment called Shining Palace of the Dharma King.

analyzed: dus gsum kun gyi tshul yang chags med thugs chud mdzad //

analyzed: thugs kyi skad cig gcig la tshad med bsam yas pa'i //

translated: a mind that is not greedy for any object, a mind that is not attached to any pleasure, a mind that is not completely attached to any enjoyment, a mind that does not hope for any ripening of all the gifts,

original: don la gzhol bar bya ba mngon par sgrub pa'i thugs yang dag par skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: don la gzhol bar bya ba mngon par sgrub pa'i thugs yang dag par skyes par gyur to //
translated: a mind that does not desire any worldly perfection, a mind that is not confused about causes and conditions, a mind that knows exactly as it is the Dharma that is well sought, and a mind that has truly arisen to accomplish the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la yang dag par zhugs pa'i thugs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la yang dag par zhugs pa'i thugs dang ldan pa /
translated: Thus, he had a mind that had truly entered into the nature of all phenomena.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad du byams pa chen pos snyoms par zhugs pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad du byams pa chen pos snyoms par zhugs pa /
translated: He was engaged in equanimity through great love for all the realms of sentient beings.

original: 'gro ba thams cad thugs rje chen po'i sprin gyis rgyas par dgang ba'i sbyor ba mnga' ba /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad thugs rje chen po'i sprin gyis rgyas par dgang ba'i sbyor ba mnga' ba /
translated: He was engaged in filling all beings with the clouds of his great compassion.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten thams cad kun nas khebs pa'i chos kyi gdugs chen po'i dkyil 'khor mnga' ba /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten thams cad kun nas khebs pa'i chos kyi gdugs chen po'i dkyil 'khor mnga' ba /
translated: He had the great Dharma parasol that completely covers the entire world of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par 'joms pa'i ye shes rdo rje'i mtshon cha mnga' ba /🔽'gro ba thams cad kyi bde ba yongs su sgrub pas dgyes pa'i shugs rnam par 'phel ba'i thugs mnga' ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par 'joms pa'i ye shes rdo rje'i mtshon cha mnga' ba / 'gro ba thams cad kyi bde ba yongs su sgrub pas dgyes pa'i shugs rnam par 'phel ba'i thugs mnga' ba /
translated: He had the weapon of the vajra of wisdom that conquers the mountain of the afflictions of all sentient beings.🔽He had a mind that increases the power of joy through accomplishing the happiness of all beings.

original: sems can thams cad la bde ba phul du phyin par mngon par sgrub pa'i smon lam gyi thugs mnga' ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bde ba phul du phyin par mngon par sgrub pa'i smon lam gyi thugs mnga' ba /
translated: He had a mind that makes the aspiration to accomplish the highest happiness for all sentient beings.

original: bsam pa dang smon pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la nor gyi char rab tu dbab pa'i thugs mnga' ba /
analyzed: bsam pa dang smon pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la nor gyi char rab tu dbab pa'i thugs mnga' ba /
translated: He had a mind that rains down wealth on all sentient beings according to their thoughts and aspirations.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong zhing snyoms par sbyor ba'i thugs mnga' ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong zhing snyoms par sbyor ba'i thugs mnga' ba /
translated: He had a mind that never abandoned any being and was impartial toward all.

original: 'phags pa'i nor gyis sems can thams cad tshim par mdzad pa'i thugs mnga' ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor gyis sems can thams cad tshim par mdzad pa'i thugs mnga' ba /
translated: He had a mind that satisfied all beings with the wealth of the noble ones.

original: stobs bcu'i ye shes rin po che phul du dri ma med pa thob par mdzad pa'i thugs mnga' ba /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i ye shes rin po che phul du dri ma med pa thob par mdzad pa'i thugs mnga' ba /
translated: He had a mind that had attained the stainless jewel of the wisdom of the ten powers.

original: byang @45b chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa chen po'i stobs dang shugs rab tu brnyes pa de /
analyzed: byang @45b chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa chen po'i stobs dang shugs rab tu brnyes pa de /
translated: He had attained the great power and strength of the bodhisattva’s higher cognitions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin chen pos sems can gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin chen pos sems can gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: He was a great cloud of the various emanations of bodhisattvas that pervaded the realm of phenomena.

original: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang ste sems can thams cad la mngon par gyur par bzhugs shing sbyin pa'i dmigs pa thams cad kyi sprin gyi char chen po rnam pa thams cad du dbab pa dang / rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyi sprin chen po'i char mngon par 'bebs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang ste sems can thams cad la mngon par gyur par bzhugs shing sbyin pa'i dmigs pa thams cad kyi sprin gyi char chen po rnam pa thams cad du dbab pa dang / rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyi sprin chen po'i char mngon par 'bebs pa mdzad de /
translated: They pervade the entire realm of space, and they are present to all sentient beings, raining down great clouds of all the objects of generosity in every way, and they cause a great rain of clouds of all precious ornaments to fall.

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad so so'i tshul dang ji ltar mthun pas longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa dang / yo byad rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa la spyad par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad so so'i tshul dang ji ltar mthun pas longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa dang / yo byad rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa la spyad par bya ba dang /
translated: In this way, in order to enjoy all the different kinds of things in accordance with the way of life of each and every sentient being, and in order to make use of the limitless different kinds of resources,

original: sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su bsdu ba'i tshul dang / dngos po yongs su gtang ba rnam pa du ma la yongs su spyad pa dang / yo byad kyi rnam pa dang / rgyan gyi 'du byed brjod du med pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su bsdu ba'i tshul dang / dngos po yongs su gtang ba rnam pa du ma la yongs su spyad pa dang / yo byad kyi rnam pa dang / rgyan gyi 'du byed brjod du med pa dang /
translated: the way to gather in beings through all kinds of generosity; the way to practice the various kinds of giving of material things; the various kinds of gifts, ornaments, and possessions;

original: sbyin pa'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs mtshan nyid sna tshogs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs mtshan nyid sna tshogs dang ldan pa /
translated: the various kinds of generosity that have various characteristics;🔽the way to satisfy beings according to their wishes through the infinite ways of generosity;🔽the way to satisfy beings according to their wishes through the infinite ways of generosity;🔽the way to satisfy beings according to their wishes through the infinite ways of generosity;🔽the way to satisfy beings according to their wishes through the infinite ways of generosity;
